page.title: 15ST.EDMUNDS CHURCH - HARGRAVE
page.content: As I write this narative about the life of the church in Hargrave, I see in my mind's eye a hollow shell of a building echoing with the sound of pigeons and haunted by bats, or sometimes just a heap of stones. I have worshipped in this place for 15 years, have cleaned pews and arranged flowers, polished the pulpit, scrubbed floors and spent hours preparing for the festivals, but I have no confidence that it will continue as a place of worship for years to come. The building itself is unremarkable. The brick tower was built in the 15th century when the Chancel was 200 years old. The font is 15th century as is the finely carved screen of a fox, a unicorn with dragons, fishes and eagles The church stands on rising ground to the north of the village beside the Rectory which is an oasis of trees amidst the surrounding prairie farmland
